text: First of all, l bring apersonal message from Dr. Howell...

text: ...who has asked me to conveyhis deep appreciation...

text: ...for the many sacrificesyou've had to make.

text: And, of course, his congratulationson your discovery...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...which may prove to be among the mostsignificant in the history of science.

text: Now...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...l know there have been someconflicting views held by some of you...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...regarding the need forcomplete security in this matter.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: More specifically, your oppositionto the cover story...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...created to give the impressionthere's an epidemic at the base.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: I understand that beyond it beinga matter of principle...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...many of you are troubledby the concern and anxiety...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...this story of an epidemic might causeto your relatives and friends on Earth.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Well, l completely sympathizewith your negative views.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: I find this cover storypersonally embarrassing, myself.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: However, I accept the needfor absolute secrecy in this.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: And l hope you will too.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: I'm sure you're all awareof the grave potential...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...for cultural shockand social disorientation...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...contained in this present situation...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...if the facts wereprematurely made public...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...without adequate preparationand conditioning.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Anyway, this is the viewof the Council.

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...on the situation...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...and to prepare a reportto the Council...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...recommending when and howthe news should eventually be announced.

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...but all the geological evidencewas against it.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Good evening.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Three weeks ago,the American spacecraft Discovery One...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...left on its half-billion-mile voyageto Jupiter.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: This marked the first manned attemptto reach this distant planet.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Earier this afternoon, The World Tonightrecorded an interview...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...with the crew of Discovery ata distance of 80 million miles from Earth.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: lt took seven minutes for our wordsto reach the giant spacecraft...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...but this time delay has been editedfrom this recording.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Our reporter Martin Amerspeaks to the crew.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: The crew of Discovery Oneconsists of five men...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...and one of the latest generationof the HAL 9000 computers.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Three of the five menwere put aboard asleep...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...or to be more precise,in a state of hibernation.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: They were Dr. Charles Hunter,Dr. Jack Kimball...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...and Dr. Victor Kaminsky.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: We spoke with mission commander,Dr. David Bowman...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...and his deputy, Dr. Frank Poole.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Good afternoon, gentlemen.How is everything going?
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Marvelous.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: We have no complaints.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: I'm glad to hear that.I'm sure the entire world...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...would join me in wishing youa safe and successful voyage.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: - Thanks very much.- Thank you.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Although hibernation has been usedon previous space efforts...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...this is the first time men have beenput into hibernation before departure.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Why was this done?
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: This was done in order to achievethe maximum conservation...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...of our life-support capabilities,basically food and air.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: The three hibernating crew membersrepresent the survey team.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: And their efforts won't be utilizeduntil we're approaching Jupiter.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Dr. Poole, what's it likewhile you're in hibernation?
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: It's exactly like being asleep.You have absolutely no sense of time.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: The only differenceis that you don't dream.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: As I understand it, you only breatheonce a minute. ls this true?
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Right, and the heart beatsthree times a minute.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Body temperature is usually down toabout three degrees centigrade.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: The sixth member of the Discovery crewwas not concerned...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...about the problems of hibernation...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...for he was the latest resultin machine intelligence:
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: The HAL 9000 computer,which can reproduce...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...though some expertsprefer to use the word "mimic"...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...most of the activitiesof the human brain...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...and with incalculably greater speedand reliability.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: We next spokewith the HAL 9000 computer...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...whom, we learned,one addresses as "Hal."
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Good afternoon, Hal.How's everything going?
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Good afternoon, Mr. Amer.Everything is going extremely well.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Hal, you have an enormous responsibilityon this mission...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...perhaps the greatest responsibilityof any single mission element.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: You're the brainand central nervous system of the ship.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Your responsibilities includewatching over the men in hibernation.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Does this ever cause youany lack of confidence?
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Let me put it this way, Mr. Amer.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: The 9000 Seriesis the most reliable computer ever made.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: No 9000 computer has evermade a mistake or distorted information.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: We are all, by any practical definitionof the words...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...foolproof and incapable of error.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Hal, despite your enormous intellect,are you ever frustrated...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...by your dependence on peopleto carry out actions?
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Not in the slightest bit.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: I enjoy working with people.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: I have a stimulating relationshipwith Dr. Poole and Dr. Bowman.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: My mission responsibilities rangeover the entire operation of the ship...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...so I am constantly occupied.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: I am putting myselfto the fullest possible use...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...which is all, I think, that anyconscious entity can ever hope to do.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Dr. Poole, what's it likeliving for most of the year...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...in such close proximity with Hal?
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: It's like what you said earlier.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: He's just likea sixth member of the crew.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: You very quickly get adjusted to the ideathat he talks, and think of him...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...really just as another person.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: In talking to the computer,one gets the sense that he's capable...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...of emotional responses.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: When l asked himabout his abilities...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...I sensed pride in his answerabout his accuracy and perfection.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Do you believethat Hal has genuine emotions?
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Well, he acts likehe has genuine emotions.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: He's programmed that wayto make it easier for us to talk to him.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: As to whether or nothe has feelings...
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...is something I don't thinkanyone can truthfully answer.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Excuse me, Frank.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: What is it, Hal?
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Fine.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Put it on here, please.Take me in a bit.

text: Certainly.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: - Hi, Frank.- Happy birthday, darling.

text: Happy birthday.Many happy returns.

text: A bit higher, Hal.
title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: Mother and I are bothfeeling wonderful.

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...that we put the unit back in operationand let it fail.

text: ...to check fault prediction.

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey

text: ...the resultsfrom our twin 9000 computer.
